{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3399648,"name":"Rafaella","username":"Rafaella.Canintech","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/ac91a4/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-06-17T20:33:27.963Z","cooked":"

Hi guys!

I’m new to this world of FRC programming, especially in Java.

My team migrated to swerve weeks before we participated in the world championship, however, previously we were using tank (as we are a rookie team), now, we will participate in an off season and we would like to improve our capabilities in swerve and java (we used LabView previously) .

Therefore, I would like some tips on this subject. Any help will be welcome

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-06-17T20:33:27.963Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":95,"reads":310,"readers_count":309,"score":537.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":467726,"topic_slug":"starting-to-program-swerve","display_username":"Rafaella","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66991,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/starting-to-program-swerve/467726/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3399649,"name":"Mr. Siefen | 453","username":"kingc95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kingc95/{size}/226662_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-17T20:36:13.200Z","cooked":"

Which swerve modules are you using? That will determine most of the advice you get. Then next is which control hardware (motors, controllers, imu) is being used as well.

Rev offers starter code for the Rev Max swerve and it assumes you use the Neo and Neo 550 setup with Spark Maxes.

CTRE based systems can use the CTRE swerve generator tools.

From those starting points there are lots of directions to go with Path planner and other systems for doing trajectory based autonmous and auto aiming in Teleop.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-06-17T20:39:11.262Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":290,"readers_count":289,"score":83.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":467726,"topic_slug":"starting-to-program-swerve","display_username":"Mr. Siefen | 453","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20632,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mr. Siefen"},"post_url":"/t/starting-to-program-swerve/467726/2","custom_user_title":"Mr. Siefen","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3399651,"name":"Rafaella","username":"Rafaella.Canintech","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/ac91a4/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-06-17T20:42:02.556Z","cooked":"

We are using the MK4I model, with 4 KRAKEN engines and 4 NEO and pigeon 2.0 engines,

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-06-17T20:42:02.556Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":267,"readers_count":266,"score":63.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":467726,"topic_slug":"starting-to-program-swerve","display_username":"Rafaella","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":20632,"username":"kingc95","name":"Mr. Siefen | 453","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kingc95/{size}/226662_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66991,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/starting-to-program-swerve/467726/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3399665,"name":"Chadfrom7226","username":"Chadfrom7226","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chadfrom7226/{size}/113429_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-17T21:38:17.229Z","cooked":"

Honestly, change those 4 NEOs to 4 Krakens or Falcons and use the swerve generator

100% worth it, especially the first time you run swerve

What encoders? CANCoders?

This is 100% true. It’s expensive, but if you can afford it, it’s the move. You essentially pay $800 for the best pre made swerve code available on the market. There are a few draw backs to it though. You essentially become locked into ctre, which is tough and can be expensive. Additionally if you run with swerve that is done for you, you may miss out on portents to learn how swerve works.

However, it’s still by far what i would recommend as ctre products are the best in the market and will be for the foreseeable future, and you don’t need need to know 100% of how it works to still take advantage of it. You just might not be taking full advantage.

It’s good advice but I wouldn’t force a team to do ctre only, many successful teams have run rev with no issues. It’s not like there no code out there for using neos with swerve. However if you have the resources then certainly try to go all ctre.

If you don’t want to switch out your motos I’d recommend taking a look at GitHub - dirtbikerxz/BaseTalonFXSwerve

It’s a great starting point and you could easily modify the code to use neos for steering instead of falcons

If you want to easily and hastly program a swerve drive, I’d recommend YAGSL. It’s an amazing library for swerve drive, which will create a swerve drive for you based on a JSON file you created with information about your swerve drive.

Hey!

Thank you for the tip, but at this moment we think it is not viable for us financially and also because we are going to participate in an off season, so we just want to learn so that next season we are fully migrated to swerve.

and to answer your question about encoders, we are using CANcoders.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-06-18T16:57:22.680Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":112,"readers_count":111,"score":27.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":467726,"topic_slug":"starting-to-program-swerve","display_username":"Rafaella","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":20021,"username":"Chadfrom7226","name":"Chadfrom7226","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chadfrom7226/{size}/113429_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66991,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/starting-to-program-swerve/467726/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3418076,"name":"Liam","username":"trixydevs","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/trixydevs/{size}/179397_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-26T00:52:17.094Z","cooked":"

With all due respect, the difference for 4 motors (and controllers) between krakens and neos is $250. Additionally, in my experience, the krakens are slightly more robust, and they contain a significant boost in soft-where. (Not to mention krakens don’t have a massive motor controller taking up space) The Neos that you have are going to be fantastic in other places, and can save you money from buying more motors later. I recognize that if you already have them, Neos can make more financial sense, however I HIGHLY emplore you to consider krakens for the sake of the generator.

On the flip side, if you don’t, I recommend YAGSDL.

Edit: Neos aren’t a bad choice at all and you shouldn’t feel BAD about using them in any way. However if you’re planning on buying motors for this coming season anyway, krakens are helpful

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-08-26T00:55:33.209Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":75,"readers_count":74,"score":55.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":467726,"topic_slug":"starting-to-program-swerve","display_username":"Liam","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":66991,"username":"Rafaella.Canintech","name":"Rafaella","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/ac91a4/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55310,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Liam | 2491 NoMythic Alum"},"post_url":"/t/starting-to-program-swerve/467726/10","custom_user_title":"Liam | 2491 NoMythic Alum","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3418082,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-26T01:57:09.378Z","cooked":"

MAXSwerve with a Vortex as the drive motor is basically just as competitive, and smaller than the Mk4/Mk4i.

There is a wealth of options out there for swerve code, as most teams run it nowadays, so whatever config you run, you’re bound to have a solution out there.

YAGSL is the most well-known. We developed our own library without too much difficulty.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-08-26T02:02:52.019Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":72,"readers_count":71,"score":34.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":467726,"topic_slug":"starting-to-program-swerve","display_username":"viggy96","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/lasarobotics/PurpleLib","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - lasarobotics/PurpleLib: Custom library for 418 Purple Haze","clicks":8}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":55310,"username":"trixydevs","name":"Liam","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/trixydevs/{size}/179397_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24613,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart"},"post_url":"/t/starting-to-program-swerve/467726/11","custom_user_title":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3418083,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-26T01:59:00.253Z","cooked":"

If you plan on sticking to using all NEO motors for your drive, I’d recommend switching encoders to either a Redux canandmag or getting through bore encoder adapters, and using the REV through bore encoder.

That way, you’ll have less CAN bus traffic, and you don’t have to periodically sync your motor encoder.

Redux Robotics

HELIUM Canandmag

Price: USD 45

andymark.com

REV Through Bore Encoder to SDS MK4i Adapter

This kit makes it easy to mount the Rev Through Bore Encoder to the SDS MK4i Swerve Modules. Included Components:2 - 8-32 x 1 in. Socket Head Cap Screw (am-1722)2 - 10-32 x 0.5 in. Button Head Cap Screw (am-1512)1 - 8-32 x 0.5 in. Button Head Cap...

REV Robotics

Through Bore Encoder

REV Robotics designs, builds and manufactures robotics parts and components used by students for learning about science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM). Our parts are commonly used within the FIRST Robotics Competition and the FIRST Tech...

Price: USD 48
